metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35518 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When binding against a DN during authentication, the reply from 389-ds-base will be different whether the DN exists or not. This can be used by an unauthenticated attacker to check the existence of an entry in the LDAP database.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
389-ds-base - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
